ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intro to concentration inequalities, probabilistic method, some other random topics in combinatorial graph theory.
I learned many interesting topics in modern combinatorics

The content varies each time this class is taught. We covered a good amount of section 1 of The Probabilistic Method (Alon and Spencer) this semester -- we did lots of tail bounding on top of/in the context of the classical examples of the probabilistic method.
I learned about the probabilistic method and random graphs and gained an insight into current research in these areas
Probabilistic method, concentration bounds, martingales, pseudorandom graphs
Basics of the probabilistic method, which turns out to be remarkably powerful for a wide range of problems

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this course would've been better with more structure, and better feedback for homeworks/exams.
The professor is quite brilliant, but the course is not very structured.

The start and end of the course felt very different. The first two thirds of the course were hard -- we just grinded through textbook topics, which is useful but also could be done on one's own. The last third of the course, after the midterm, were student presentation (on various relevant papers/topics). These tended to be pretty interesting.

Prof. Vu is an excellent lecturer, but I wish he would have lectured morethe second half of the semester was entirely dedicated to student presentations. I also feel that the course could have been better organized (for example, providing lecture notes or directing students to relevant textbook sections prior to the lecture).

Strengths: Lectures were amazing, textbook was very good, HW was reasonable, exams were stressful but reasonable
Weaknesses: None

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Not really - I thought the course wasn't very well done.
It gives a good introduction to probabilistic methods.
I would recommend this course to a student who is very interested in combinatorics and is willing to put in effort on challenging problem sets and is willing to learn about these topics on their own.

Yes, I found the content interesting and Prof. Vu is an excellent lecturer! Note that the class does not focus on enumerative combinatorics, but instead on topics such as the probabilistic method and various concentration inequalities. Also, be ready for pop quizzes.
Yes, Prof. Vu is a great lecturer and you will learn a lot.
